Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is partially grey in section and contains a large number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 1 () wine of the domain of Neferkheperura.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26-27/895 (?) TA:26-27/695 (?;also marked) (?)
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393483) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393483)
